7205a141c22dde7b965a595633f70175 (02:22): -I have a question about searching hierarchial data in mysql

09a56028a63f8e9351a49d2f8c51f8df (02:24): +!tell gleam about trees because infi is his daddy
ac5c74b64b4b8352ef2f181affb5ac2a (02:24): +But I don't know a thing about that.
7205a141c22dde7b965a595633f70175 (02:25): -well I've read all of that before
7205a141c22dde7b965a595633f70175 (02:25): -I am trying to search the tree's/subtrees' leaves

7205a141c22dde7b965a595633f70175 (02:27): -I am trying to do something like, "show me all leaves, where second level parents id is 1" and I don't know how many levels there are between the root, the parent [id=1] and the leaves
7205a141c22dde7b965a595633f70175 (02:27): -I know it can easily be done in xml and xpath/xquery
7205a141c22dde7b965a595633f70175 (02:28): -my question is "can it be done the similar way in MySQL" without exporting thousands of records into xml and then querying the  xml file
e90f5641d6fa817046da26762ec36e59 (02:33): -Sergey; XML as in processing it in the application layer?
e90f5641d6fa817046da26762ec36e59 (02:33): -Sergey; XML parsers are not the fastest at handling large amounts of data.
7205a141c22dde7b965a595633f70175 (02:36): -I just think thats would be the easiest way for me to get the data I need. I am not sure if it is the fastest
e90f5641d6fa817046da26762ec36e59 (02:37): -Sergey; easiests, but not the most efficient.
e90f5641d6fa817046da26762ec36e59 (02:38): -Sergey; What is your application wrote in?
7205a141c22dde7b965a595633f70175 (02:38): -my other option was to make an index table that would link a parent on every level with all its eventual children
7205a141c22dde7b965a595633f70175 (02:39): -but that would make the index table n times bigger than the amount of children, where n is the number of generations
7205a141c22dde7b965a595633f70175 (02:41): -so I guess stored procedures is my only option
e90f5641d6fa817046da26762ec36e59 (02:46): -Sergey; and depending on hardware, a much more scalable solution than PHP. Given the new advancements in MySQL's clustering technoloy.
